text: ਪਉੜੀ ॥

translation.text: Pauree:

transliteration.text: paurī .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਵਡਾ ਕਰਿ ਸਾਲਾਹੀਐ ਜਿਸੁ ਵਿਚਿ ਵਡੀਆ ਵਡਿਆਈਆ ॥

translation.text: Praise the Great True Guru; within Him is the greatest greatness.

transliteration.text: satigur vadā kar sālāhīai jis vich vadīā vadiāīā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਸਹਿ ਮੇਲੇ ਤਾ ਨਦਰੀ ਆਈਆ ॥

translation.text: When the Lord causes us to meet the Guru, then we come to see them.

transliteration.text: sah mēlē tā nadarī āīā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:

As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਜਾ ਤਿਸੁ ਭਾਣਾ ਤਾ ਮਨਿ ਵਸਾਈਆ ॥

translation.text: When it pleases Him, they come to dwell in our minds.

transliteration.text: jā tis bhānā tā man vasāīā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਕਰਿ ਹੁਕਮੁ ਮਸਤਕਿ ਹਥੁ ਧਰਿ ਵਿਚਹੁ ਮਾਰਿ ਕਢੀਆ ਬੁਰਿਆਈਆ ॥

translation.text: By His Command, when He places His hand on our foreheads, wickedness departs from within.

transliteration.text: kar hukam masatak hath dhar vichah mār kadhīā buriāīā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਸਹਿ ਤੁਠੈ ਨਉ ਨਿਧਿ ਪਾਈਆ ॥੧੮॥

translation.text: When the Lord is thoroughly pleased, the nine treasures are obtained. ||18||

transliteration.text: sah tuthai nau nidh pāīā .18.

text: ਸਲੋਕੁ ਮਃ ੧ ॥

translation.text: Shalok, First Mehl:

transliteration.text: salōk mah 1 .

text: ਪਹਿਲਾ ਸੁਚਾ ਆਪਿ ਹੋਇ ਸੁਚੈ ਬੈਠਾ ਆਇ ॥

translation.text: First, purifying himself, the Brahmin comes and sits in his purified enclosure.

transliteration.text: pahilā suchā āp hōi suchai baithā āi .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਸੁਚੇ ਅਗੈ ਰਖਿਓਨੁ ਕੋਇ ਨ ਭਿਟਿਓ ਜਾਇ ॥

translation.text: The pure foods, which no one else has touched, are placed before him.

transliteration.text: suchē agai rakhiōn kōi n bhitiō jāi .

text: ਸੁਚਾ ਹੋਇ ਕੈ ਜੇਵਿਆ ਲਗਾ ਪੜਣਿ ਸਲੋਕੁ ॥

translation.text: Being purified, he takes his food, and begins to read his sacred verses.

transliteration.text: suchā hōi kai jēviā lagā paran salōk .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਕੁਹਥੀ ਜਾਈ ਸਟਿਆ ਕਿਸੁ ਏਹੁ ਲਗਾ ਦੋਖੁ ॥

translation.text: But it is then thrown into a filthy place - whose fault is this?

transliteration.text: kuhathī jāī satiā kis ēh lagā dōkh .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਅੰਨੁ ਦੇਵਤਾ ਪਾਣੀ ਦੇਵਤਾ ਬੈਸੰਤਰੁ ਦੇਵਤਾ ਲੂਣੁ ਪੰਜਵਾ ਪਾਇਆ ਘਿਰਤੁ ॥

translation.text: The corn is sacred, the water is sacred; the fire and salt are sacred as well; when the fifth thing, the ghee, is added,

transliteration.text: ann dēvatā pānī dēvatā baisantar dēvatā lūn panjavā pāiā ghirat .

text: ਤਾ ਹੋਆ ਪਾਕੁ ਪਵਿਤੁ ॥

translation.text: then the food becomes pure and sanctified.

transliteration.text: tā hōā pāk pavit .

text: ਪਾਪੀ ਸਿਉ ਤਨੁ ਗਡਿਆ ਥੁਕਾ ਪਈਆ ਤਿਤੁ ॥

translation.text: Coming into contact with the sinful human body, the food becomes so impure that is is spat upon.

transliteration.text: pāpī siu tan gadiā thukā paīā tit .

text: ਜਿਤੁ ਮੁਖਿ ਨਾਮੁ ਨ ਊਚਰਹਿ ਬਿਨੁ ਨਾਵੈ ਰਸ ਖਾਹਿ ॥

translation.text: That mouth which does not chant the Naam, and without the Name eats tasty foods

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਏਵੈ ਜਾਣੀਐ ਤਿਤੁ ਮੁਖਿ ਥੁਕਾ ਪਾਹਿ ॥੧॥

translation.text: - O Nanak, know this: such a mouth is to be spat upon. ||1||

text: ਭੰਡਿ ਜੰਮੀਐ ਭੰਡਿ ਨਿੰਮੀਐ ਭੰਡਿ ਮੰਗਣੁ ਵੀਆਹੁ ॥

translation.text: From woman, man is born; within woman, man is conceived; to woman he is engaged and married.

transliteration.text: bhand janmīai bhand ninmīai bhand mangan vīāh .

translation.text: Woman becomes his friend; through woman, the future generations come.

text: ਭੰਡੁ ਮੁਆ ਭੰਡੁ ਭਾਲੀਐ ਭੰਡਿ ਹੋਵੈ ਬੰਧਾਨੁ ॥

translation.text: When his woman dies, he seeks another woman; to woman he is bound.

transliteration.text: bhand muā bhand bhālīai bhand hōvai bandhān .

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਭੰਡੈ ਬਾਹਰਾ ਏਕੋ ਸਚਾ ਸੋਇ ॥

translation.text: O Nanak, only the True Lord is without a woman.

text: ਜਿਤੁ ਮੁਖਿ ਸਦਾ ਸਾਲਾਹੀਐ ਭਾਗਾ ਰਤੀ ਚਾਰਿ ॥

translation.text: That mouth which praises the Lord continually is blessed and beautiful.

transliteration.text: jit mukh sadā sālāhīai bhāgā ratī chār .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਤੇ ਮੁਖ ਊਜਲੇ ਤਿਤੁ ਸਚੈ ਦਰਬਾਰਿ ॥੨॥

translation.text: O Nanak, those faces shall be radiant in the Court of the True Lord. ||2||

transliteration.text: nānak tē mukh ūjalē tit sachai darabār .2.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਪਉੜੀ ॥

text: ਸਭੁ ਕੋ ਆਖੈ ਆਪਣਾ ਜਿਸੁ ਨਾਹੀ ਸੋ ਚੁਣਿ ਕਢੀਐ ॥

translation.text: All call You their own, Lord; one who does not own You, is picked up and thrown away.

transliteration.text: sabh kō ākhai āpanā jis nāhī sō chun kadhīai .

text: ਕੀਤਾ ਆਪੋ ਆਪਣਾ ਆਪੇ ਹੀ ਲੇਖਾ ਸੰਢੀਐ ॥

translation.text: Everyone receives the rewards of his own actions; his account is adjusted accordingly.

transliteration.text: kītā āpō āpanā āpē hī lēkhā sandhīai .

text: ਜਾ ਰਹਣਾ ਨਾਹੀ ਐਤੁ ਜਗਿ ਤਾ ਕਾਇਤੁ ਗਾਰਬਿ ਹੰਢੀਐ ॥

translation.text: Since one is not destined to remain in this world anyway, why should he ruin himself in pride?

transliteration.text: jā rahanā nāhī ait jag tā kāit gārab handhīai .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਮੰਦਾ ਕਿਸੈ ਨ ਆਖੀਐ ਪੜਿ ਅਖਰੁ ਏਹੋ ਬੁਝੀਐ ॥

translation.text: Do not call anyone bad; read these words, and understand.

transliteration.text: mandā kisai n ākhīai par akhar ēhō bujhīai .

text: ਮੂਰਖੈ ਨਾਲਿ ਨ ਲੁਝੀਐ ॥੧੯॥

translation.text: Don't argue with fools. ||19||

text: ਸਲੋਕੁ ਮਃ ੧ ॥

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਫਿਕੈ ਬੋਲਿਐ ਤਨੁ ਮਨੁ ਫਿਕਾ ਹੋਇ ॥

translation.text: O Nanak, speaking insipid words, the body and mind become insipid.

transliteration.text: nānak phikai bōliai tan man phikā hōi .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਫਿਕੋ ਫਿਕਾ ਸਦੀਐ ਫਿਕੇ ਫਿਕੀ ਸੋਇ ॥

translation.text: He is called the most insipid of the insipid; the most insipid of the insipid is his reputation.

transliteration.text: phikō phikā sadīai phikē phikī sōi .

text: ਫਿਕਾ ਦਰਗਹ ਸਟੀਐ ਮੁਹਿ ਥੁਕਾ ਫਿਕੇ ਪਾਇ ॥

translation.text: The insipid person is discarded in the Court of the Lord, and the insipid one's face is spat upon.

text: ਫਿਕਾ ਮੂਰਖੁ ਆਖੀਐ ਪਾਣਾ ਲਹੈ ਸਜਾਇ ॥੧॥

translation.text: The insipid one is called a fool; he is beaten with shoes in punishment. ||1||

text: ਅੰਦਰਹੁ ਝੂਠੇ ਪੈਜ ਬਾਹਰਿ ਦੁਨੀਆ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਫੈਲੁ ॥

translation.text: Those who are false within, and honorable on the outside, are very common in this world.

transliteration.text: andarah jhūthē paij bāhar dunīā andar phail .

text: ਅਠਸਠਿ ਤੀਰਥ ਜੇ ਨਾਵਹਿ ਉਤਰੈ ਨਾਹੀ ਮੈਲੁ ॥

translation.text: Even though they may bathe at the sixty-eight sacred shrines of pilgrimage, still, their filth does not depart.

transliteration.text: athasath tīrath jē nāvah utarai nāhī mail .

text: ਜਿਨ੍ਹ ਪਟੁ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਬਾਹਰਿ ਗੁਦੜੁ ਤੇ ਭਲੇ ਸੰਸਾਰਿ ॥

translation.text: Those who have silk on the inside and rags on the outside, are the good ones in this world.

transliteration.text: jinh pat andar bāhar gudar tē bhalē sansār .

text: ਤਿਨ੍ਹ ਨੇਹੁ ਲਗਾ ਰਬ ਸੇਤੀ ਦੇਖਨ੍ਹੇ ਵੀਚਾਰਿ ॥

translation.text: They embrace love for the Lord, and contemplate beholding Him.

text: ਰੰਗਿ ਹਸਹਿ ਰੰਗਿ ਰੋਵਹਿ ਚੁਪ ਭੀ ਕਰਿ ਜਾਹਿ ॥

text: ਪਰਵਾਹ ਨਾਹੀ ਕਿਸੈ ਕੇਰੀ ਬਾਝੁ ਸਚੇ ਨਾਹ ॥

text: ਦਰਿ ਵਾਟ ਉਪਰਿ ਖਰਚੁ ਮੰਗਾ ਜਬੈ ਦੇਇ ਤ ਖਾਹਿ ॥

translation.text: Sitting, waiting at the Lord's Door, they beg for food, and when He gives to them, they eat.

text: ਦੀਬਾਨੁ ਏਕੋ ਕਲਮ ਏਕਾ ਹਮਾ ਤੁਮ੍ਹਾ ਮੇਲੁ ॥
